title: Startup: Selecting NHL.TV Channel successfully opens NHL.TV
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND has gone to the "Channel Store"
AND has added "NHL.TV"
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "NHL.TV" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN "NHL.TV" will open successfully

title: Startup: NHL.TV can be accessed while the Roku is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to a wireless network
AND "NHL.TV" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "NHL.TV" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN "NHL.TV" will open successfully

title: Startup: NHL.TV can be accessed while the Roku is connected using a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to a wired network connection
AND "NHL.TV" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects "NHL.TV" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN "NHL.TV" will open successfully

title: Startup: There is no visual overlapping after changing device display settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND "NHL.TV" channel is installed
custom_steps:
WHEN the user observes the UI current display
THEN exits the app and accesses the device's Settings > Display type
AND changes the settings within the Display type section
THEN launches the NHL app again
custom_expected:
THEN there will be no data overlap
AND all images will display accordingly
AND all text will display accordingly

title: Home: Verify if there are games available for Today that the Featured Games displays on the Home Screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed NHL.TV
AND there are games scheduled for Today
custom_steps:
WHEN we access the app
AND we are brought to the main menu page
custom_expected:
THEN the Large Games tile will display on the Main Menu
and 4 smaller tiles for 
Scores Calendar Standings video

title: Home: Verify the default highlighted selection when the app is accessed is the Featured Game Widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND there are games scheduled for today
custom_steps: WHEN the user is brought to the Main Menu
custom_expected: THEN the Large Featured Tile option will be highlighted by default

title: Home: The Home menu is able to be navigated and the highlight moves accordingly to the user's input
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user uses the navigation arrows
AND toggles between the different Menu Options
custom_expected: THEN the highlight moves correctly based on the input from the Roku Remote

title: Home: Featured Games option displays the correct games for that day
custom_preconds:
Given the user accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND that the season isn't over
AND there are games scheduled for today
custom_steps: WHEN the user enters the app and reaches the home page
custom_expected: THEN Featured Games will appear accordingly

title: Home: Verify that Game Data updates/refreshes every so often
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Home section
AND there are games currently live/active
custom_steps:
WHEN a team scores
OR a game state changes
custom_expected:
THEN the data will be properly reflected when the new info becomes available

*Home Screen only
Display Game State

title: Home: Verify options display accordingly
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the Main Menu
custom_expected:
THEN the following Menu Items will display:
> Featured Games in Large Tiles
> Scores
> Calendar
> Standings
> Video
> Settings*

title: Home:  	Verify text and formatting is clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the Menu
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be clear
AND all text will be formatted correctly

title: Settings: User selects 'Settings' opens page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects 'Settings' from the menu options
custom_expected: THEN the 'Settings' page will open accordingly

title: Settings: Menu options when user is not logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND has never signed into NHL.tv
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings Menu
custom_expected:
THEN the following options will display:
> How to Purchase NHL.TV
> Team Calendar
> Favorite Teams
> Hide Scores - On / Off
> Play Live Game From - Live
> Log In

Also displays the NHL Shield AND Version number

title: Settings: Menu options when user is logged in with an account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND has previously logged in
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page
custom_expected:
THEN the following options will display:
> Team Calendar 
> Favorite Teams
> Hide Scores - On / Off
> Play Live Game From - Live
> About NHL.TV
> Log Out

Also displays the NHL Shield AND Version number

title: Settings: Verify user remains logged in after an app update
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has logged in with a valid account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user exits the application
AND updates the NHL.tv app build
AND relaunches the NHL.tv app
custom_expected:
THEN the user's credentials will remain logged in
AND the user will be able to play a stream without being prompted to login

title: Settings: Verify TOS appears for Rogers on first time login
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have logged out of the current build on the device
AND have deleted the old app build
AND have power-cycled the device
AND have loaded a brand new build
AND we have accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any account
AND the tester has a new (or never used) Rogers account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Setting page using the * on the remote
AND changes the login interface to login to a MyRogers account
AND applies the credentials of their account (new or never used)
custom_expected:
THEN the Rogers NHL GameCentre LIVE Terms of Service screen will appear

NOTE: DO NOT [I REPEAT] DO NOT SELECT 'OK' TO PROCEED THROUGH THE TOS SCREEN UNTIL YOU READ THIS
Only proceed through the TOS screen if you do not have any other associated Rogers accounts to work with.
If you already have other Rogers accounts, back out of the TOS screen to preserve the account for future testing.

title: Settings: Verify no TOS appears when logging into Rogers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any account
AND the user has a previously used Rogers account
AND the user has knowingly accepted the Terms of Service before
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Setting page using the * on the remote
AND changes the login interface to login to a MyRogers account
AND applies the credentials of their Rogers account
custom_expected: THEN the Rogers NHL GameCentre LIVE Terms of Service screen will NOT appear

title: Team Calendar: Full NHL team list appears and default is "None"
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
AND has not accessed or set a team for the calendar
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Team Calendar option from settings menu
custom_expected:
THEN the page will update to display the complete list of NHL teams
AND the default setting highlighted will be "None"

title: Team Calendar: All NHL team logos display and contain 'R' or 'TM' symbol
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Team Calendar option from settings menu
AND traverses slowly down the list of teams
custom_expected:
THEN each team's logo will appear without issue
AND the logo will contain either an 'R' or 'TM' symbol

title: Team Calendar: Selecting a team updates the Team Calendar menu option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
AND has not set a team for the calendar
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Team Calendar option
AND selects any team from the list
custom_expected:
THEN the page will navigate back to the main settings page
AND the selected team will appear next to the "Team Calendar" option
(eg. Team Calendar - San Jose Sharks) - Choose a few a random

title: Teams - Favorites: Overlay appears with instructions to managing favorites
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Favorite Teams option
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear with the header "Favorite Teams"
AND messaging directing the user of how to manage favorites
AND options to "Go Back" and "Refresh"

title: Teams - Favorites: Choosing a Favorite team online updates the app
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is logged into a valid premium account
AND has not set up any user favorites
AND has accessed the Settings menu
AND has the NHL.com website up on a desktop
AND is logged in to the same login credentials as the app
custom_steps:
WHEN the user accesses the NHL.com website
AND selects the WATCH header option
THEN selects Watch NHL.TV menu option
THEN selects a game with a video stream
AND launches the game's video stream
THEN selects the 'Gear' icon at the top of the page
THEN selects the TEAMS option
AND adds a team to the Favorites list
THEN goes to the app and selects the Favorite Teams option
AND upon the overlay appearing, selects the 'Refresh' button
custom_expected:
THEN the 'Team Calendar' option on the app will update
AND the name of the selected team will appear next to it
(eg. Team Calendar - San Jose Sharks) - up to 5 selections

title: Teams - Followed: Choosing teams to follow updates the ordering of the Scores display
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is logged into a valid premium account
AND has not set up any user favorites
AND has accessed the Settings menu
AND has the NHL.com website up on a desktop
AND is logged in to the same login credentials as the app
custom_steps:
WHEN the user accesses the NHL.com website
AND selects the WATCH header option
THEN selects Watch NHL.TV menu option
THEN selects a game with a video stream
AND launches the game's video stream
THEN selects the 'Gear' icon at the top of the page
THEN selects the TEAMS option
AND adds a team to the Followed list
THEN goes to the app and selects the Favorite Teams option
AND upon the overlay appearing, selects the 'Refresh' button
THEN accesses the Scores page
AND traverses through the days
custom_expected:
THEN the user will observe that the Followed teams appear first (in order selected on desktop) each day
AND making changes within the Followed list will be respectfully followed by the app (up to 5 selections)

title: Hide Scores: Verify selecting the Hide Scores option presents an overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has not accessed it previously
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page the first time
custom_expected: THEN "Hide Scores" will be OFF by default

title: Hide Scores: Verify Hide Scores is set to OFF by default
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has installed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has not accessed it previously
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Settings page the first time
custom_expected: THEN "Hide Scores" will be OFF by default

title: Hide Scores: Setting is retained when user exits application and returns
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has modified the Hide Scores setting
custom_steps:
WHEN the user exits the application
AND the user accesses a different Roku Channel
THEN accesses the NHL.TV Channel again
custom_expected: THEN the "Hide Scores" setting that the user set will be retained

title: Play Live Game From: Selecting the Play Live Game From option displays overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Play Live Game From option
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear displaying:
"Play Live Game From Start"

AND options
> On
> Off

title: Play Live Game From: Selecting the OFF option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
AND has selected the Play Live Game From option
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the OFF option
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND the option in Settings will show
"Play Live Game From - Live"

title: Play Live Game From: Playing a live game from 'Live' will begin from the current LIVE position
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
AND has selected the Play Live Game From option
AND has selected the OFF option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user finds a live game occurring
AND selects to watch the live stream
custom_expected: THEN playback will begin from the current live point

title: Play Live Game From: Selecting the ON option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
AND has selected the Play Live Game From option
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the ON option
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND the option in Settings will show
"Play Live Game From - Start"

title: Play Live Game From: Playing a live game from 'Start' will begin from the beginning of the video stream
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
AND has selected the Play Live Game From option
AND has selected the ON option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user finds a live game occurring
AND selects to watch the live stream
custom_expected: THEN playback will begin from the beginning

title: About: About NHL.TV screen displays correctly and exits
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the About NHL.TV option
custom_expected:
THEN the following message appears:

"NHL and the NHL Shield are registered trademarks and NHL.TV and NHL GameCenter LIVE are trademarks of the National Hockey League. All NHL logos and marks and NHL team logos and marks depicted herein are the property of the NHL and the respective teams and may not be reproduced without the prior written consent of NHL Enterprises, L.P. NHL [YEAR].
All Rights Reserved
Visit NHL.com/termsofservice and NHL.com/privacy"

AND an OK button appears at the bottom of the screen
AND selecting the OK button puts the user back to the Settings options

title: About: Confirm any URLs in section are correct in web ROKU p1 regression
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the About NHL.TV option
AND sees any URLs in the section
AND manually inputs/tests each URL displayed in a web browser
custom_expected:
THEN the URL(s) will be valid
AND will open to the respective page

NOTE:  If a URL redirect occurs, it is still considered a 'pass' as long as the page is valid (no 404s) and the page redirected to makes sense.

title: Log In: Selecting the Log In option displays text field and keyboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Log In option
custom_expected:
THEN the screen updates to display a text box
AND messaging showing "Enter your NHL.com Account Email"
AND a device keyboard
AND options below the keyboard:
> Next
> Cancel
> Log In with MyRogers Account

title: Log In: Selecting 'Cancel' at Log In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters a string of characters into the text field
AND selects the 'Cancel' option
custom_expected:
THEN the Log In screen will dismiss
AND the user will be brought back to the Settings screen
AND the user will not be logged in

title: Log In: Selecting 'Next' at Log In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters a string of characters into the text field
AND selects the 'Next' option
custom_expected:
THEN the string of characters will disappear
AND the text field and keyboard will remain
AND the page will update to the Password screen
AND under the text field will display "Enter Password"
AND there are options displayed:
> OK
> Cancel

title: Log In: Logging in with incorrect credentials on NHL.tv
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters an invalid email address and/or password
(Attempt to provide an invalid email address with any password and a valid email address with incorrect password)
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will display the message:
"Unable to Log In - The account credentials you entered did no match our records. Please visit NHL.com/forgot to reset them."
AND selecting the OK button will return the user to the Password screen

title: Log In: Selecting 'Cancel' at Password
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters an email address
AND selects the Next button
AND enters a password
AND selects the 'Cancel' button
custom_expected:
THEN the Password screen will change back to the Log In screen
AND the email previously inputted will remain in the text field

title: Log In: Logging in with valid NHL.tv credentials
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters a valid NHL.com email address
AND selects the Next button
AND enters a valid password associated to the email
AND selects the 'OK' button
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear stating:
"Login Successful - You have successfully logged in."
AND selecting the 'OK' button will dismiss the overlay
AND the user will be back on the Settings screen 
AND "Log In" will now be replaced with "Log Out"

title: Log In: Selecting 'Log In with MyRogers Account' at Log In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the 'Log In with MyRogers Account' option
custom_expected:
THEN the user interface will update with the following:
-NHL.tv image will change to the Rogers GameCentre Live image
-Under the text box, "NHL.com" will be replaced with "MyRogers"
-Under the 'Cancel' option, "MyRogers" will be replaced with "NHL.com"

title: Log In: Logging in with incorrect credentials on MyRogers
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
AND has changed the Log In UI to MyRogers
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters an invalid email address and/or password
(Attempt to provide an invalid email address with any password and a valid email address with incorrect password)
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will display the message:
"Unable to Log In - Please try again"

title: Log In: Logging in with valid MyRogers credentials
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user enters a valid Rogers account email address
AND selects the Next button
AND enters a valid password associated to the email
AND selects the 'OK' button
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear stating:
"Login Successful - You have successfully logged in."
AND selecting the 'OK' button will dismiss the overlay
AND the user will be back on the Settings screen 
AND "Log In" will now be replaced with "Log Out"

title: Log In: Attempting to use NHL.tv credentials on MyRogers log in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
AND has selected the 'Log In with MyRogers Account' option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to log in with valid NHL.com account email credentials
(Note:  Make sure log in credentials used are only valid for NHL.com)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will NOT be validated
AND an overlay will display the message:
"Unable to Log In - Please try again"

title: Log In: Attempting to use MyRogers credentials on NHL.tv log in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is not signed into the app with an account
AND has accessed the Settings screen
AND has selected the Log In option
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to log in with valid Rogers account email credentials
(Note:  Make sure log in credentials used are only valid for MyRogers)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will NOT be validated
AND an overlay will display the message:
"Unable to Log In - The account credentials you entered did no match our records. Please visit NHL.com/forgot to reset them."

title: Log Out: Selecting the Log Out option displays Logout overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is signed into the app with a valid account
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Log Out option
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear with the following messaging:
"You are about to log out of your user account.
To view NHL.TV you must log in with a valid account.
To view subscription content, an account is required."

AND there are options
> Yes
> No

title: Log Out: Selecting 'No' at Log Out
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is signed into the app with a valid account
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Opt Out button
AND selects the 'No' option
custom_expected:
THEN the Logout overlay will dismiss
AND the user will still be logged in

title: Log Out: Selecting 'Yes' at Log Out
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.tv Channel
AND is signed into the app with a valid account
AND has selected the 'Options' button on the remote
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Opt Out button
AND selects the 'Yes' option
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND the user will be logged out
AND the Log Out option will now display "Log In"

title: Calendar: User selects 'Calendar' opens page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Calendar from the menu options
custom_expected: THEN the Calendar page will open accordingly

title: Calendar: Cursor highlight should open to into the Team Picker (No Favorite Team Selected)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Today's Games section
AND the user hasn't chosen a favorite team
custom_steps: WHEN the page opens
custom_expected: THEN the team picker opens so the user can select a team

title: Calendar: Cursor highlight should start at the next live game (Favorite Team)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Today's Games section
AND the user has chosen a favorite team
custom_steps: WHEN the page opens
custom_expected: THEN the cursor highlight should default to the next live game for the user's favorite team

title: Calendar: Verify all games can be navigated to and selected within the month
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the Calendar section
AND there are more than one games available for the month
custom_steps:
WHEN the page loads
AND the user traverses through the games
custom_expected:
THEN all games can be highlighted
AND all games are selectable

title: Calendar: Verify all months of games schedules can be navigated to and into to view games of that month
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has selected the Calendar section
custom_steps:
WHEN the page loads
AND the user traverses up into the month tab
custom_expected:
THEN all months can be highlighted
AND all games are selectable when entering each month

title: Calendar: Verify that Game Data updates/refreshes every so often
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Calendar section
AND there are games currently live/active
custom_steps:
WHEN a team scores
OR a game state changes
custom_expected: THEN the data will be properly reflected when the new info becomes available

title: Calendar: Verify Show Scores is set by default
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user has never navigated to the settings page
AND there are games that are In Progress
OR there are games that have moved to Final
AND the user selected the Today's Games page
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the day's games
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the scores for the games in the data overlays 
Verify Scores are visible on default launch

title: Calendar: Verify that Scores are hidden when the user sets the variable in Settings to Hide Scores
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user has enabled hide scores
AND there are games that are In Progress
OR there are games that have moved to Final
AND the user selected the Calendar page
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the day's games
custom_expected: THEN the user will not see the scores for the games in the data overlays

title: Calendar: Verify the Away team is always displayed on the Left with the Home Team displayed on the Right
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user has navigated to the Calendar section
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses through the day's games
AND looks at the team matchup logos
custom_expected:
THEN the Away team will always display on the Left
AND the Home team will always display on the Right

title: Calendar: Verify Team Logos on the right correspond with selected Team Matchup on the left
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to the Calendar section
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates through the different games for the month
custom_expected:
THEN the team logos on the left will correspond with the team name below the tile on the left
AND the team logos on the right will correspond with the team name below the tile on the right

title: Calendar: Verify text and formatting is clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the has navigated to the Calendar
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the month's games
custom_expected:
THEN all text will be clear
AND all formatting will be without issue

title: Standings: Verify that the user is able to access the Standings Page from the Main Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Standings from the menu options
custom_expected: THEN Standings page will open accordingly

title: Standings: Verify all the data inside this page is accurate to the data on NHL.com
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Standings Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates between Division and Wildcard
custom_expected: THEN the user is presented with accurate information about the teams' standings in the season according to NHL.com

title: Standings: Verify the user can switch between Division and Wildcard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we are within or nearing the NHL post season
AND if not, the tester must request the functionality be made available on the QA server
AND the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Standings Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps left or right on the d-pad
custom_expected: THEN the screen should shift between the Division and Wildcard Standings

title: Standings: Verify all font and numbers are legible and displaying correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Standings Page
custom_expected: THEN all the fonts and numbers shown to the user are clearly legible and understandable to the user

title: Standings: Verify that the user is able to exit this section from either Division or Wildcard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Standings Page
AND is on the Division Section
OR is on the Wildcard Section
custom_steps: WHEN the user press BACK BUTTON on the roku located at the top left of the remote
custom_expected: THEN the user should be back on the Main Page

title: Scores: Verify that the user is able to access the Scores from the Home Page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user tries to access the Scores page from the Main Menu
custom_expected: THEN the user should be placed on the Scores page without any issues

title: Scores: Verify that entering the Scores Page defaults to the next live game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Main Menu
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects Scores from the menu options
custom_expected:
THEN Scores page will open to today's live games (if applicable)

NOTE:  Schedule flip occurs at 9 AM Pacific/12 PM Eastern.  
If testing before schedule flip, today's scores will be yesterday's matchups.
This is an expected behavior.

title: Scores: Verify that the user is able to navigate the games inside the day selected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user press Right or Left on the D-Pad on the Roku
custom_expected: THEN the app should update to the new tile with all the correct information about that game

title: Scores: Verify that the user is able to select Two days before and after plus every day in-between (yesterday,today,tomorrow)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
AND is highlighting any of the dates at the top of the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user press down on the d-pad
custom_expected: THEN the user should be given games pertaining to the day shown and should be navigated

title: Scores: Verify entering any game located in the Scores Page brings the user to the game page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
AND is highlighting a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses OK located in the middle of the Roku Remote
custom_expected: THEN the user should be directed to the game page showing all the information to the game selected

title: Scores: Verify that the text and scores are clear and accurate
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates through the Scores page
custom_expected: THEN all the data shown in this section should be legible and displayed clearly to the user

title: Scores: Verify that each game shown in this page should be accurate and pulling the right information.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user highlights any game shown in the Scores Page
custom_expected: THEN the user should be given the correct information that is detailed on NHL.com

title: Scores: Verify that the Team logos correspond correctly to who is home and who is away.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user highlights any game shown in the Scores Page
custom_expected: THEN the tile should display the right team logos over the corresponding team name

title: Scores: Verify that the @ symbol is displayed correctly in-between the logos and the team names
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Scores Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user highlights any game shown in the Scores Page
custom_expected: THEN the title should have an @ in-between both team logos indicating which is the home team and which is the away team

title: Matchup: Verify when user highlights an archived game tile, the metadata appears properly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a day with Final game listings (archives)
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to a completed matchup
custom_expected:
THEN the following metadata is present:
> Team logos
> Team name @ Team name
> Score (if setting is 'On')

title: Matchup: Verify when user highlights a future game tile, the metadata appears properly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a day with future game listings
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to a future matchup
custom_expected:
THEN the following metadata is present:
> Team logos
> Team name @ Team name
> Game time
> Game date

NOTE: Data in, data out - at times, the game date might be replaced with a channel (eg. "NBCSN") - this would still be a Pass.

title: Matchup: Verify displayed metadata respects the Hide Scores setting
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN the user toggles between the Hide Scores on/off setting
THEN navigates to the Scores tile to an already played matchup
AND observes the information displayed in both states
custom_expected: THEN the info will toggle between the actual game's scores and "Final" text accordingly

title: Matchup: Verify team names are spelled correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses through several days
AND traverses through the games within those days
AND observes the team matchups
custom_expected: THEN all team names observed are spelled correctly

title: Matchup: Home teams are always listed after Away teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses through the matchups
custom_expected:
THEN the Away team will be listed first
AND an "@" symbol will be be next
AND the Home team will be listed after

title: Matchup: Verify the metadata properly updates as the user navigates across different game cells
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
custom_steps: WHEN the user traverses the navigation across different game matchups
custom_expected: THEN the metadata displayed properly updates to reflect the newly highlighted game matchup information

title: Matchup: Text and game state formatting on games should be clear and readable
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user traverses through matchups
AND the metadata is visible
custom_expected: THEN all text and images will be displayed and formatted clearly

title: Free Game: Verify that free games will not play for a user not linked to any account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the channel is not linked to any NHL Account
AND there is a Free Game available

NOTE: You may have to research on another device which game(s) are free as Roku does not display any indicators (yet)
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to play a Free Game asset
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to a login page
AND will be instructed to login with subscription upsell info

title: Free Game: Verify that free games will play for a user linked with a free NHL account

AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to an NHL.com account with No Entitlements
AND there is a Free Game available

NOTE: You may have to research on another device which game(s) are free as Roku does not display any indicators (yet)
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to play a Free Game asset
custom_expected:
THEN the user will NOT be prompted with a pay wall
AND start options will display (Start from Beginning, Jump to Period, Cancel)
AND starting the feed will launch the player and playback begins

custom_expected:
THEN start options will display (Start from Beginning, Jump to Period, Cancel)
AND starting the feed will launch the player and playback begins

custom_expected:
THEN start options will display (Start from Beginning, Jump to Period, Cancel)
AND starting the feed will launch the player and playback begins

custom_preconds:

custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Scores tile from the Home screen

custom_expected:
THEN the matchup should show an indication of Free Game

title: Free Game: Verify that both NHL.tv accounts and Rogers accounts display the same free games

custom_steps:
WHEN we login with an NHL.tv account
AND notate some of the free games
THEN we logout of the NHL.tv account
AND login with a Rogers account
THEN observe the previously notated free games
custom_expected: THEN the list of free games will match

AND there is a game that has completed
AND 'Hide Scores' option is set to ON
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a completed matchup
AND observe the metadata displayed
custom_expected: THEN the text "Final" will appear under the matchup team names

AND has navigated to a section with game listings
AND there is a game that has completed
AND 'Hide Scores' option is set to OFF
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a completed matchup
AND observe the metadata displayed
custom_expected: THEN final scores will appear under the matchup team names

custom_steps:

custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a completed matchup that ended in OT
AND observe the metadata displayed
custom_expected: THEN final scores will appear under the matchup team names

custom_expected:
THEN we will see the correct matchup being displayed

AND there is a Game Recap available for a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Play Game Recap option
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive an ad 
AND then the recap video will begin

custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.com with No Entitlements
AND there is a Game Recap for a game available
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Play Game Recap option
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive an ad 
AND then the recap video will begin

custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Play Game Recap option

custom_expected:

custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to a valid NHL.TV Account
AND there is a Game Recap for a game available
custom_steps:
WHEN the user plays the Game Recap
AND the Recap playback reaches the end
custom_expected: THEN we will be returned to the Game Page

title: Game: Pressing Play button on Game Page launches Start Options for Default Video Stream
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an authorized NHL.TV Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a Game Page with active media (Live/Archive)
AND we press the Play button on the Roku Remote
custom_expected: THEN we are presented with the Start Options for the main video stream

title: Game: Verify options when there is no media available
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an authorized NHL.TV Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a game page with no media present
(No live or archived videos exist - can use a future game)
AND we observe the options displayed on the page
custom_expected:
THEN there will be no Watch options
AND there will be no Game Recap option
AND there will be a 'Go Back' option

title: Game: Verify options when there is media available and the user is linked to a valid account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an authorized NHL.TV Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a game page with active media (Live/Archive)
AND we observe the options displayed on the page
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the 'Watch' options for the labeled available feeds
AND we will see the 'Play Game Recap' option (if available)

title: Game: Verify options when there is media available and the user is not linked to an account
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have NOT linked to an authorized NHL.tv account
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to a game page with active media (Live/Archive)
AND we observe the options displayed on the page
custom_expected:
THEN we will see the 'Watch' options for the labeled available feeds
AND we will see the 'Play Game Recap' option (if available)
AND selecting any of the 'Watch' options will display a Log In / Upsell screen
(NOTE:  "Watch Highlights" option will not display a paywall - ok to launch)

title: Game: Verify future game data appears correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND there is a game that has not yet began
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates to the Game Details page for a future game
custom_expected:
THEN the user is taken to the Game Detail view 
AND the user can see the following attributes:
> Team logos
> Team name @ Team name
> Go Back button
> Both team records
> Game time
> Game date

title: Game: Verify the Away team is listed at the Home team
custom_preconds: GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates to the Game Details page for any game
(choose a few matchups at random)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the Away team on the left side of the "@" symbol
AND the user will the Home team on the right side of the "@" symbol

title: Delayed State: Verify Game Detail view is clickable and no longer updating with post delay data
custom_preconds:
Given we have opened up Game Detail view for a game
And this game is currently in the status of Delayed
custom_expected: Then we no longer see any data updating with post Delay data

title: Delayed State: Verify Game appears as 'Delayed' or 'Del' on scoreboard and in Game Detail view
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the Scoreboard
custom_steps: When the game goes into or is put into a Delayed state
custom_expected:
Then that state is indicated on the scoreboard 
And that state is indicated on the Game Detail view

title: Delayed State: Verify all possible delayed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard view
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of delay, Rain, Snow, Ceremony, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the delayed state without issue

title: Postponed State: Verify all possible postponed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard view
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of postponement, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the Postponed state without issue

title: Postponed State: Verify Game Detail view is no longer updating with post delay data
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected a game
And this game is currently in a state of Postponement
custom_steps: When the user views the Game Detail view
custom_expected:
Then they are able to click around successfully
And the data inside that particular game will not update any longer

title: Suspended State: Verify Game appears as 'Suspended' or 'Susp' on scoreboard and in Game Detail view
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_expected:
Then the game should appear as suspended on the scoreboard
And the game will appear as suspended in all the Gameday Detail view

title: Suspended State: Verify all possible delayed game states function properly (rain, snow, etc)
custom_preconds: Given the user is on the scoreboard view
custom_steps: When the game is put into any type of suspension, Rain, Snow, Tragedy, etc
custom_expected: Then if should reflect the suspended state without issue

title: Suspended State: Verify suspended game is sorted properly in the scoreboard according to the sorting rules
custom_preconds: Given that the user is on the scoreboard page
custom_steps: When there is a game that is suspended
custom_expected:
Then the game should move to the bottom of the list past the games that are in progress
And the game should move to the bottom of the list past the games that are still scheduled to be played

title: Suspended State: Verify Game Detail view is no longer updating with post delay data
custom_preconds:
Given we have selected a game
And we have opened that game to it's Game Detail view
And that game is currently in the state of Suspend
custom_expected:
Then we are able to navigate successfully
And we no longer see any data updating for that particular game

title: Final State: Verify Game appears as 'Final' in the Game Detail view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
AND Hide Scores is set to OFF
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has selected a game that has been completed
AND navigates into the Game Detail view
custom_expected: THEN the text "Final" should appear under the scores

title: Final State: Verify that a game completed in Overtime displays as "Final" in the Game Details
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
AND Hide Scores is set to OFF
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has selected a game that was completed in Overtime
AND navigates into the Game Detail view
custom_expected: THEN the text "Final" should appear under the scores

title: Final State: Verify no "Final" text appears in the Game Details with Hide Scores ON
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has navigated to a section with game listings
AND Hide Scores is set to ON
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has selected a game that has been completed
AND navigates into the Game Detail view
custom_expected: THEN the text "Final" should not appear anywhere

title: Launch: User selects Start from beginning
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has previously begun watching an NHL.TV stream
AND exited the playback before completion
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the game
AND chooses the option to Watch
AND selects 'Start from beginning'
custom_expected:
THEN the video playback will launch
AND the stream will restart at the beginning

title: Launch: User selects Resume
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user has already begun viewing an NHL.TV stream
AND the user has exited the stream before completion
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the previously watched game
AND attempts to watch it again
AND presses the Resume option
custom_expected: THEN the video stream will continue where the user left off

title: Launch: User selects Jump to Period (archive)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid NHL.TV account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects to watch an NHL.TV archive
AND selects the 'Jump to Period' option
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to an Period navigation control
AND selecting this will bring the user to the corresponding video location

title: Launch: User selects Cancel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects to Watch an NHL.TV stream
AND is at the 'Choose Start Option' screen
AND selects Cancel
custom_expected:
THEN the 'Choose Start Option' menu will close
AND the user will be brought back to the game's page

title: Launch: Verify "Resume" is not an available option for a stream that has not been started before
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is linked to a valid NHL.TV account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user chooses to Watch an NHL.TV feed
AND has not previously attempted to watch this feed
custom_expected: THEN the user will NOT see the 'Resume' option in the Choose start option menu

title: Period: When choosing the 'Watch' option for an Archive, the user sees a 'Jump to period' option
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user is linked to a valid NHL.TV account
AND there is an archive available
custom_steps: WHEN the user attempts to watch the archive feed
custom_expected: THEN the user will see an option to 'Jump to Period'

title: Period: Selecting 'Jump to period' opens appropriate navigation page
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is linked to a valid NHL.TV account
AND the user has accessed an NHL.TV Archive
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects 'Jump to Period'
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought to an Period navigation page

title: Period: 'Jump to Period' displays proper period options for selected games
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND there are multiple Archives available
AND there are Archives for games that ended in more than 3 periods
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to watch the Archive Feeds
AND selects the Jump to Period option
custom_expected: THEN the Period navigation page matches the amount of periods for the selected game(s)

title: Period: Selecting an period accurately jumps the user to the appropriate video position
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user has linked to a valid NHL.TV account
AND there are Archive games available
custom_steps: WHEN the user uses the Jump to Period option when launching an archive stream
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the selected Period frame
AND the video will begin playing at that point successfully

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Free account that we are unable to watch premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to an NHL.TV Free Account
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free NHL.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will not be able to play the stream

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Single Team account that we are able to view the chosen team's premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to an NHL.TV Single Team Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.tv stream
AND the stream involves the team the user is paying to watch
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to an NHL.TV Single Team account that we are unable to view a non-chosen team's premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to an NHL.TV Single Team Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.tv stream
AND the stream does NOT involve the team the user is paying to watch
custom_expected:
THEN the user will not be able to play the stream
AND messaging will appear regarding not being entitled and to subscribe/upgrade the account

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to a monthly NHL.TV Premium subscribed account that we can view premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to an NHL.TV Monthly Account
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to a yearly NHL.TV Premium subscribed account that we can view premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to an NHL.TV Annual Account
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to a yearly Rogers GamePlus subscribed account that we can view premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to a Full Season Rogers GamePlus Account
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to a monthly Rogers GamePlus subscribed account that we can view premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to a monthly Rogers GamePlus Account
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.TV stream
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to play the stream successfully

title: Auth: Verify that if we have linked to a Rogers Free account that we are unable to watch premium content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have followed the steps to link to an NHL.TV Account
AND we have linked to a Rogers GameCentre Free Account
custom_steps: WHEN we attempt to play a non-Free (premium) NHL.TV stream
custom_expected:
THEN the user will NOT be able to play the stream
AND an upsell messaging screen will appear

custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Roku device is connected using a wireless network connection
AND we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND there is a live game available to view
custom_steps: WHEN we launch playback of the live video stream
custom_expected: THEN the stream will launch and play successfully

GIVEN the Roku device is connected using a wireless network connection
AND we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND there is an archived game available to view
custom_steps: WHEN we launch playback of the archived video stream
custom_expected: THEN the stream will launch and play successfully

AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND there is a live game available to view
custom_steps: WHEN we launch playback of the live video stream

custom_steps: WHEN we launch playback of the archived video stream

title: Playback: Pressing the 'OK' button during playback brings up game overlay information
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND the user has launched a stream for a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the 'OK' button on the remote
custom_expected:
THEN an overlay will appear
AND the Matchup details for the game will display
AND the Duration will display (for archives)

title: Playback: Pressing the up arrow on the D-pad backs out of playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has launched an NHL.TV stream
custom_steps: WHEN the user presses the Up navigation arrow on the remote
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be exited out of the video playback
AND the user will be brought Back to the Game's page

title: Playback: The Fast-Forward button functions as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is signed into a valid premium account
AND has launched a video stream for a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Fast-Forward button on the remote control
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will pause
AND an icon with 3 arrows (one small, one medium, one large) will display
AND the video timeline will appear
AND the time stamp, along with the indicator, will begin to traverse forward

title: Playback: The Fast-Forward button increments as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is signed into a valid premium account
AND has launched a video stream for a game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Fast-Forward button once on the remote control (A)
WHEN the user selects the Fast-Forward button a second time on the remote control (B)
WHEN the user selects the Fast-Forward button a third time on the remote control (C)
WHEN the user selects the Fast-Forward button a fourth time on the remote control (D)
custom_expected:
THEN the video will pause
AND the video timeline will appear
AND the time stamp, along with the indicator, will begin to traverse forward
(A) slowly - and the Fast-Forward icon shows the small arrow color-filled
(B) moderately - and the Fast-Forward icon shows the small and medium arrows color-filled
(C) rapidly - and the Fast-Forward icon shows the small, medium and large arrows color-filled
(D) slowly - the user will have gone through all 3 speeds and circled back to the 1st speed

title: Playback: The Rewind button functions as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is signed into a valid premium account
AND has launched a video stream for a game
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Rewind button on the remote control
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will pause
AND an icon with 3 arrows (one small, one medium, one large) will display
AND the video timeline will appear
AND the time stamp, along with the indicator, will begin to traverse backward

title: Playback: The Rewind button increments as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is signed into a valid premium account
AND has launched a video stream for a game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Rewind button once on the remote control (A)
WHEN the user selects the Rewind button a second time on the remote control (B)
WHEN the user selects the Rewind button a third time on the remote control (C)
WHEN the user selects the Rewind button a fourth time on the remote control (D)
custom_expected:
THEN the video will pause
AND the video timeline will appear
AND the time stamp, along with the indicator, will begin to traverse backward
(A) slowly - and the Rewind icon shows the small arrow color-filled
(B) moderately - and the Rewind icon shows the small and medium arrows color-filled
(C) rapidly - and the Rewind icon shows the small, medium and large arrows color-filled
(D) slowly - the user will have gone through all 3 speeds and circled back to the 1st speed

title: Playback: The Play/Pause button functions as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is signed into a valid premium account
AND has launched a video stream for a game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Play/Pause button on the remote control
AND selects it more than once during playback
custom_expected: THEN the video stream will Pause or Play respectively

title: Playback: The 'Instant Replay' button functions as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
AND have allowed it to play for at least 2 minutes
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the 'Instant Replay' button (reverse arrow loop icon)
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will jump back approximately 25 seconds
AND playback will resume right away from the point it jumped to

title: Playback: Allow complete playback of an archived game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is signed into a valid premium account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has launched an archived game from the beginning
AND allows it to play completely through to the end
custom_expected:
THEN the stream will play without any (or minimal) hiccups
AND upon completion, the stream will gracefully end
AND the user is brought back to the Game Detail screen

title: Bookmarks: User returns to a previous streamed game, the Resume option is present
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has linked to a valid NHL.TV account
AND has previously accessed an NHL.TV stream for a game
AND did not complete the playback
custom_steps:
WHEN the user returns to the game
AND attempts to Watch the feed
custom_expected: THEN the Choose start Option menu will include the option to Resume

title: Bookmarks: User's previous location is stored even if the user exits the application and returns
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND has linked to a valid NHL.TV account
AND has previously accessed a game stream
AND has not completed the playback
custom_steps:
WHEN the user presses the Home button on the remote control
AND the user attempts to access the Channel again
AND returns to the game previously being watched
AND chooses the same Watch option from prior
AND selects to Resume the playback
custom_expected:
THEN the option to Resume playback is displayed
AND in selecting it, the stream will resume from where it left off

(BLOCK THIS CASE FOR NOW - TO BE IMPLEMENTED IN A FUTURE BUILD)

title: CC/Audio:  Selecting the 'Options' button on the remote displays an overlay
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the 'Options' button (asterisk icon)
custom_expected:
THEN the video stream will pause
AND an overlay with the header "Closed caption/audio configuration" will appear

title: CC/Audio: Closed caption/audio configuration options
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND observe the Closed caption/audio configuration overlay
custom_expected:
THEN the following options will be seen:
> Captions mode: <On>/<Off>/<Instant replay>
> Audio selection not available
> OK
> Cancel

title: CC/Audio: Turning Captions Mode 'ON' displays captions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
AND Captions are turned OFF
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND we toggle the Captions mode to 'On'
AND we select the OK button
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND caption text will begin to appear on screen

title: CC/Audio: Captioning text on screen is clear and legible
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
AND Captions are turned ON
custom_steps: WHEN we observe the caption text that appears on screen
custom_expected: THEN it will be legible and clear of any unintentional artifacts

title: CC/Audio: Turning Captions Mode 'OFF' no longer displays captions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
AND Captions are turned ON
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND we toggle the Captions mode to 'Off'
AND we select the OK button
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND caption text will disappear from the screen

title: CC/Audio: Turning Captions Mode to 'Instant Replay' does not display captions
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND we toggle the Captions mode to 'Instant Replay'
AND we select the OK button
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND no caption text will appear on screen

title: CC/Audio: Captions Mode 'Instant Replay' functions as expected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
AND we have toggled the Captions Mode to 'Instant Replay'
custom_steps:
WHEN we press the 'Instant Replay' button on the remote (reverse arrow loop button)
AND the video jumps back approximately 25 seconds
custom_expected:
THEN playback will resume right away from the point it jumped to
AND caption text will begin to appear on screen
AND caption text will disappear upon reaching the original jump back point

title: CC/Audio: Audio configuration does nothing
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND select the 'Audio selection not available' option
custom_expected:
THEN nothing happens because it's not available

(NOTE:  Update this test case when something has implemented here)

title: CC/Audio: Selecting the 'OK' button submits the configuration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND change a configuration from within the overlay
AND select the 'OK' button
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND the configuration change will occur

title: CC/Audio: Selecting the 'Cancel' button dismisses the configuration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND we have linked to an NHL.tv or Rogers Premium account
AND we have launched a game stream
custom_steps:
WHEN we select the 'Options' button on the remote
AND change a configuration from within the overlay
AND select the 'Cancel' button
custom_expected:
THEN the overlay will dismiss
AND the configuration change will NOT occur

title: Video: Selecting the Video tile opens the Video screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Home screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the Video tile
custom_expected: THEN the app will change to display the Video screen

title: Video: Video screen and tiles display appropriately
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Home screen
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects the Video tile
AND observes the Video screen
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the following:
-Video counter showing which video # you're on out of how many videos are available (eg. "#|40")
-Single row of video thumbnails, displaying 5 videos at a time
-Header of the videos shows "Most Popular"
-Video in focus has a highlighted border
-Video metadata displays for the video thumbnail in focus

title: Video: Navigation of the Video screen
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Video screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates right and left
custom_expected:
THEN the focus is always on the center tile
AND the metadata updates on each left/right click
AND the video counter ascends or descends respectfully
AND navigating the carousel left/right is a continuous loop

title: Video: Video metadata displays clearly and accurately
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Video screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user has a particular video in focus
custom_expected:
THEN metadata will display clearly with the following information:
-Team@Team: Title of the Video
-Video duration
-Video description, limited to 3 rows
-Displays ellipsis on line 3 (if applicable)

title: Video: Videos playback appropriately
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Video screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects a video
custom_expected:
THEN an ad will load and play first
AND the selected video will play directly after

title: Video: Videos playback in sequence continuously
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has accessed the NHL.TV Channel
AND is on the Video screen
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects a video
AND allows it to play completely
custom_expected:
THEN the video will end
AND an ad will play
THEN the next video in the sequence will play
AND this behavior will continue throughout the list

NOTE: After the last video (40|40), the app should stop playback and gracefully exit to the Video screen

title: Deeplinking confirm working Roku P1 regression
custom_preconds:
Specific software to send the HTTP requests (HttpRequester, cURL, Wget, Netcat) should be installed on your PC. 

MAC users: Use TERMINAL for Curl Commands

NOTE: Should be ran on the app channel (not sideload)
custom_steps:
The channel (app) should be added to your Roku box and linked if it requires linking. 
To pick necessary id by channel (app) name in HTTP requests software use the following GET command: 

curl http://<IP>:8060/query/apps IP - your device IP address (Settings - About - IP address)

1) In HTTP requests software use the following POST command: 
curl -d ' ' http://<IP>:8060/launch/<appID>?contentID=2016020271

2) In HTTP requests software use the following POST command: 
curl -d ' ' http://<IP>:8060/keypress/back
custom_expected:
1) App launches and navigates directly to a game details page
(using the contentID from the Steps, navigates to Nov. 20 CBJ vs. WSH)
2) App navigates back to home/scoreboard screen
